children.name: showroom
children.definition: noun phòng trưng bày
examples: a large shop in which people are encouraged to look at the goods that are on sale before buying them
_acarshowroom
_Our complete range of carpets is on display in our showroom.

children.name: shop/ store
children.definition: shopespecially British /storeespecially American /ʃɒpǁʃɑːp, stɔːʳ/  a building or place where things are sold:
examples: ▪ Could you run down to the shop and get me some cigarettes?
▪ A lot of the stores on the main street had been boarded up
▪ I asked in my local record shop but they couldn’t help me
▪ I saw Helen at the grocery store this morning.
▪ I got it from the secondhand furniture shop.
▪ a new health food shop
▪ It’s where the old jewelry store used to be.
shopnoun[ C ]PLACE TO BUY THINGS cửa hàng, cửa hiệu
(US usuallystore) a building, or a room in a building, where you can buy goods or get services
_a book/clothes/record/sweet shop
_a barber's/betting shop
_I need to go to the shops - I've got no food in the house.
storenounSHOPcửa hàng, cửa hiệu
[ C ]USany type of shop
_a clothing/liquor store
_a convenience store

children.name: chain store
children.definition: /ˈtʃeɪn stɔːʳ/  one of a group of large shops that have the same name and are owned by the same company:
examples: ▪ A lot of the old Victorian buildings are being pulled down to make way for chain stores.
chain storenoun[ C ]
một trong một loạt cửa hàng giống nhau thuộc sở hữu của cùng một công ty
(one of) a group of shops which belong to a single company, having the same appearance and selling similar goods

children.name: outlet
children.definition: nounSHOP cửa hàng tiêu thụ, đại lý (của một công ty)
examples: a shop that is one of many owned by a particular company and that sells the goods which the company has produced
_a fast-food outlet
_a retail outlet
retail outlet/ˈriːteɪl ˌaʊtlet/ [countable noun] a shop where a company sells its goods - use this inbusinessorlegalcontexts:
cửa hàng bán lẻ
▪ Benetton has retail outlets in every major European city
▪ The company has been forced to close hundreds of its retail outlets.

children.name: variety store
children.definition: nounUS (từ Mỹ, nghĩa Mỹ) tiệm tạp hoá
examples: a shop which sells many different things, usually at low prices

children.name: a lot of shops together in one place
shopping centre
children.definition: British /shopping centerAmerican /ˈʃɒpɪŋ ˌsentəʳǁˈʃɑːp-/  an area in a town where there are a lot of shops that have all been built together in the same place:
examples: ▪ The boy was found dead two days after he disappeared from a shopping centre.
▪ They had a big Santa exhibition on at the shopping center.
shopping centreUK,USshopping center
noun[ C ] trung tâm buôn bán, trung tâm thương mại
a group of shops with a common area for cars to park, which usually provides goods and services for local people

children.name: mall /shopping mall X
children.definition: mall/shopping mall/mɔːl, ˈʃɒpɪŋ mɔːlǁˈʃɑːp-/  especially American a very large building with lots of shops inside it, and often also cinemas, restaurants etc:
examples: ▪ We’ll probably go to the mall and check out the beds there.
▪ It’s difficult to get a parking space at Shepherd’s Mall.
mallnoun[ C ] (alsoshopping mall)khu vực cấm xe cộ đi lại và thường có mái che, có nhiều cửa hàng
a large, usually covered, shopping area where cars are not allowed
_There are plans to build a new mall in the middle of town.
shopping mallnoun[ C ] (alsomall)mainly US milk
khu vực cấm xe cộ đi lại và thường có mái che, có nhiều cửa hàng
a large usually covered shopping area where cars are not allowed

children.name: strip mall
children.definition: /ˈstrɪp mɔːl/  American a row of shops in one long building that has space to park cars around it:
examples: ▪ Strip malls were springing up all over town, and the local residents were up in arms.

children.name: precinct
children.definition: /ˈpriːsɪŋkt/  British an area of a town where there are a lot of shops, especially one where vehicles are not allowed:
examples: ▪ They’ve got a lovely new Burton’s open in the precinct now.
shopping precinct
▪ They wandered around the shopping precinct for an hour while Suzie was having her hair cut.
pedestrian precinct
▪ I think they should make the whole area a pedestrian precinct.
pedestrian precinctnoun[ C ] (US usuallypedestrian mall)
khu vực của một thành phố (nhất là khu mua bán) không cho xe cộ vào
a covered area with shops where vehicles are not allowed
precinctnounSHOPPING AREA khu vực không cho xe cộ vào
[ C ]UKpart of a city or a town in which vehicles are not allowed
and which is used for a special purpose, especially shopping
_a shopping precinct
_a pedestrian precinct

children.name: market
children.definition: /ˈmɑːʳkɪt, ˈmɑːʳkət/  an area, usually outdoors, where people buy and sell many different types of things:
examples: ▪ I bet you could have got that cheaper at the market.
▪ You occasionally see eel in the fish market, but it’s quite rare these days.
farmer’s market
place where farmers can sell what they grow and other food
flea market
place where old and used things are sold
marketnoun[ C ]PLACE chợ
a place or event at which people meet in order to buy and sell things
_Fruit and vegetables are much cheaper from/in/onthe market than in the supermarket.
_She runs a stall in/on the market.
_Theindoorflower market is a big tourist attraction.
_a craft market
_The town's always busy on marketday.

children.name: flea market
children.definition: noun chợ trờ i
examples: a market, which usually takes place outside, where old or used goods are sold cheaply

children.name: supermarket
children.definition: alsogrocery storeAmerican /ˈsuːpəʳˌmɑːʳkɪt, ˈsuːpəʳˌmɑːʳkət, ˈgrəʊsəri ˌstɔːʳ/  alargeshop that sells a wide range of things, especially food, cleaning materials, and other things that people buyregularly:
examples: siêu thị
▪ Can you get pine nuts in the grocery store?
▪ There are plans to open a new supermarket next year.
supermarketnoun[ C ] siêu thị
a large shop which sells most types of food and other goods needed in the home, in which people take from shelves the things they want to buy and pay for them as they leave
grocerynounSHOP cửa hàng tạp phẩm; cửa hàng tạp hoá
[ C ] (UK alsogrocery shop,US alsogrocery store)
old-fashioneda grocer's

children.name: department store
children.definition: /dɪˈpɑːʳtmənt ˌstɔːʳ/  a very large shop that is divided into several big parts, each of which sells one type of thing, such as clothes, furniture, or kitchen equipment:
examples: thương xá , cửa hàng lớn phân thành nhiều khu cho các loại mặt hàng khác nhau
▪ We couldn’t find anything we wanted in the big department stores, and then we came across this little boutique.
department storenoun[ C ]
a large shop divided into several different parts, each of which sells different things

children.name: superstore
children.definition: /ˈsuːpəʳstɔːʳ, ˈsjuː-ǁˈsuː-/  British a very large modern shop, especially one that is built outside the centre of a city:
examples: ▪ A new Tesco superstore is being planned for the site.
superstorenoun[ C ] cửa hàng lớn
anextremelylarge shop which sells food and/or other goods
usually for use in the home at cheaper prices than most other shops
_a DIY superstore
_an out-of-town superstore

children.name: store
children.definition: nounSHOP cửa hàng lớn
examples: [ C ]UKa large shop where you can buy many different types of goods
_a department store
_a DIY/furniture store

children.name: megastore
children.definition: nouncửa hàng lớn
examples: a very large shop
_a furniture megastore

children.name: grocery store
children.definition: supermarketalsoAmerican /ˈsuːpəʳˌmɑːʳkɪt, ˈsuːpəʳˌmɑːʳkət, ˈgrəʊsəri ˌstɔːʳ/  alargeshop that sells a wide range of things, especially food, cleaning materials, and other things that people buyregularly:
examples: siêu thị
▪ Can you get pine nuts in the grocery store?
▪ There are plans to open a new supermarket next year.
supermarketnoun[ C ] siêu thị
a large shop which sells most types of food and other goods needed in the home, in which people take from shelves the things they want to buy and pay for them as they leave
grocerynounSHOP cửa hàng tạp phẩm; cửa hàng tạp hoá
[ C ] (UK alsogrocery shop,US alsogrocery store)
old-fashioneda grocer's

children.name: kiosk
children.definition: /ˈkiːɒskǁ-ɑːsk/  a very small shop on a street, that has an open window where you can buy newspapers, cigarettes, chocolate etc:
examples: ▪ There must be a kiosk selling phone cards around here somewhere.
kiosknoun[ C ] quán (bán sách, giải khát...)
a small building where things such as sweets, drinks or newspapers are sold through an open window
_a station kiosk

children.name: convenience store
children.definition: /kənˈviːniəns ˌstɔːʳ/  especially American a shop in your local area that sells food, alcohol, magazines etc and is often open 24 hours a day:
examples: cửa hàng tiện lợi
▪ Believe me, if his father wasn’t so rich, that guy would be working in a convenience store.
convenience storenoun[ C ] cửa hàng mở cửa phục vụ đến đêm
mainly USa shop that sells food, drinks, etc. and is usually open until late

children.name: stall /stand C1
children.definition: stallespecially British /standAmerican /stɔːl, stænd/  a table, especially in a market, where goods are placed:
examples: ▪ Justin used to mind the stall while his father was in the cafe, drinking.
▪ I bought a few trinkets at the souvenir stand.
market stall
▪ The trouble is, you can’t really try the clothes on at a market stall.
stallnounSHOP quầy bày hàng
[ C ] a large table or a small shop with an open front from which goods are sold in a public place
_In the village market, the stalls are piled high with local vegetables.
standnounSHOP gian hàng, quán (ở chợ); cấu trúc (bàn, quán) bán hàng hoá
[ C ] a small shop orstallor an area where products can be shown, usually outside or in a large public building,at which people can buy things or get information
_a hotdog stand
_Over three thousand companies will have stands

children.name: corner shop
children.definition: British /corner storeAmerican /ˈkɔːʳnəʳ ˌʃɒpǁ-ˌʃɑːp, ˈkɔːʳnəʳ ˌstɔːʳ/  asmalllocal shop, usually on the corner of a street, that sells food, newspapers, cigarettes etc:
examples: ▪ The corner shop’s started selling sandwiches now, and I’d rather go there than the supermarket.
▪ His parents ran a little corner store in the Castro in San Francisco.
corner shopnoun[ C ]UK
a small shop, especially on a corner of a road, which sells common foods and other objects that are useful in the house

children.name: fair
children.definition: noun hội chợ
examples: a large show at which people who work in a particular industry meet, and sell and advertise their products
_a book/antiques/toy fair
_a trade fair

children.name: discount store
children.definition: noun cửa hàng bán giá rẻ hơn thông thường; cửa hàng hạ giá
examples: a shop which sells its goods at cheap prices

children.name: charity shop
children.definition: charityshopnoun cửa hàng từ thiện
examples: a shop in which a charity sells all types of used goodswhich are given by the public, or in which they sell newgoods, to make money for the work of the charity

children.name: thrift shop
children.definition: nounUS(UKcharity shop)

children.name: cửa hàng mua bán đồ cũ; cửa hàng mua bán đồ đã qua sử dụng
examples: a shop which sells clothes and other goods that people no longer want,
in order to raisemoney for people who are ill or have no food, homes, etc.

children.name: a shop where a pawnbroker operates their business
pawn shop
children.definition: noun (alsopawnbroker's) hiệu cầm đồ
examples: a shop where a pawnbroker operates their business

children.name: a shop where things for your house are sold
hardware store
children.definition: alsohardware shopBritish /ˈhɑːdweəʳ ˌstɔːʳ, ˈhɑːdweəʳ ˌʃɒpǁ-ˌʃɑːp/  a shop that sells equipment and tools that you can use in your home or garden

children.name: gift shop
children.definition: noun chuyên bán những mặt hàng làm quà biếu
examples: a shop which sells goods which are suitable for giving as presents

children.name: DIY store
children.definition: British /home improvement centerAmerican /ˌdiː aɪ ˈwaɪ stɔːʳ, ˌhəʊm ɪmˈpruːvmənt ˌsentəʳ/  a very large shop that sells equipment and tools for repairing and decorating your home:
examples: ▪ You’ll find these at your local home improvement center.

children.name: garden centre
children.definition: British /nurseryespecially American /ˈgɑːʳdn ˌsentəʳ, ˈnɜːʳsəri/  a place that sells a wide range of plants, seeds, and things for your garden:
examples: ▪ It’s the only good garden centre around here.
garden centrenoun[ C ] nơi chuyên kinh doanh hạt giống, cây kiểng, dụng cụ làm vườn
a place where you can buy things such as plants and equipment for your garden

children.name: a shop conected with beauty and fashion
salon
children.definition: nounSHOP thẩm mỹ viện
examples: a shop where you can get a particular service, especially connected with beauty orfashion
_a beauty salon
_a hairdressing/hair salon

children.name: boutique
children.definition: noun
examples: a small shopthat sells fashionable clothes, shoes, jewellery, etc.

children.name: a shop where medicines are sold
chemist/chemist's
children.definition: chemistnounMEDICINE
examples: UK(UK alsochemist's,USdrugstore,alsopharmacy) a shop where you can buy medicines, make-up and products used for washing yourself

children.name: drugstore
children.definition: noun hiệu thuốc; cửa hàng dược phẩm; nhà thuốc
examples: US forchemist (= a shop where you can buy medicines, make-up, sweets, cigarettes,etc.)

children.name: pharmacy
children.definition: noun cửa hàng dược phẩm; nhà thuốc
examples: [ C ] a shop or part of a shop in which medicines are prepared and sold

children.name: chemist
children.definition: alsochemist’sBritish /drugstoreAmerican /ˈkemɪst, ˈkeməst, ˈkemsts, ˈdrʌgstɔːʳ/  a shop that sells medicines, beauty and baby products etc

children.name: pharmacy
children.definition: /ˈfɑːʳməsi/  especially American a shop or part of a shop where medicines are made and sold

children.name: a shop where books, newspapers or office equipments are sold
newsagent’s/newsagent
children.definition: /ˈnjuːzˌeɪdʒənts, ˈnjuːzˌeɪdʒəntǁˈnuːz-/  British a shop that sells newspapers and magazines, cigarettes, chocolates etc:
examples: ▪ Ruth waited for him outside the newsagent’s.
newsagentnoun[ C ]UK shopbán báo
(alsonewsagent's) a shop whose main business is selling newspapers and magazines
_Do you want anything from the newsagent's apart from a paper?

children.name: bookshop/ bookstore
children.definition: bookshopnounmainly UK(US usuallybookstore) hiệu sách
examples: a shop where books are sold

children.name: newstand/newsstand
children.definition: /ˈnjuːzstændǁˈnuːz-/  a small structure on a street, that sells newspapers and magazines:
examples: ▪ He bought a paper at a newstand near the entrance to the park.
newsstandnoun[ C ] quầybáo
a table or temporary structure used as a small shop for selling newspapers and magazines outside in public places

children.name: stationer's
children.definition: nounUK cửa hàng, cửa hiệubán văn phòng phẩm

children.name: a shop which sells stationery
examples: _You'll be able to get a tube of glue at the stationer's down the road.

children.name: bookstall
children.definition: nounmainly UK quầy bán sách
examples: a table or a very small shop with an open front where books, magazines, etc. are sold
